name: CVE-2018-16183
description: An unquoted search path vulnerability in some pre-installed applications on Panasonic PC run on Windows 7 (32bit), Windows 7 (64bit), Windows 8 (64bit), Windows 8.1 (64bit), Windows 10 (64bit) delivered in or later than October 2009 allow local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse executable file and execute arbitrary code with eleveted privileges.
pattern: [((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:panasonic:system_interface_device_0021:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10:*:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8:*:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*')) OR ((software:cpe='cpe:2.3:a:panasonic:system_interface_device_0040:-:*:*:*:*:*:*:*') AND (software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_7:*:*:*:*:*:*:*:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_10:*:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8.1:*:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*' OR software:cpe='cpe:2.3:o:microsoft:windows_8:*:*:*:*:*:*:x64:*'))]

external_references.description: This object was created using cve2stix from the Signals Corps.
